top_comments.comment:
I am disappointed in you derek, you are exaggerating the amount of hardware needed. you keep showing 5 DIFFERENT "GAMEBOYS" as if you need all that to do this. hell at 9:38 you even admit you don't even need ONE GAMEBOY to do this. all you need is the n64, the disk drive, the transfer pack, the gb camera, and the 2 software. honestly i am surprised you didn't have a n64 controller in that image just to inflate the hardware further. 

besides, if you are playing simcity, you would already own the the dd. so unless you want to be ridiculous and go "this is insane, in order to play stardew valley you got to have a keyboard, a mouse, a power supply, a monitor, a motherboard..." otherwise you could just say....

"In order to put your friend into simcity, you need to get the studio software, a gameboy camera, and a transfer pack." never have i been so irked by a punching weight.
Yoo you've got a hori gamepad for the gcn? Save some of the good hardware for the rest of us!

About those lines in the gameboy camera pictures, those are likely electrical interference. I don't know how the camera works, but it's likely a shoddy sensor or a bad low cost tech that's susceptible to interference. The lines are regular and fixed, which would make me guess that it's coming from the gcn itself. Could be any kind of signal, or just a field coming from the traces on the board, a wire, literally anything could be causing it.

@3:29 from what I recall the "perfect head mode" (hehe) was removed because of the recent school shootings in America and Nintendo's concern that people would put unauthorized pictures of others and creating a PR nightmare and tainting Nintendo's kid friendly image.

comments_since_last_sample.body: Oh how amazing it would have been to be transferred to Perfect Dark and fight against my friends. Luckily though, there was a character there already, which looked much like I was already. With a big nose and long hair in a ponytail. I always chose him and even more amazingly, all my friends I played the game with also had scans of people who looked very much like them, so we always chose them and the illusion of fighting against each other was real. We were lucky.
SimCity 2000 technically had 2 N64 ports, one that sticks true to the original game, and the 3D follow-up to SimCity on the SNES, both exclusive in Japan
Thank you uncle Derek and producer Grace
It's a me, Derek.

"You want more of them D's?"
-raises eyebrow in anticipation
"64DD's that is" 
-sad eyebrow lowering noises
The way to my heart: play Gameboy games on a GameCube. First Korone with WarioWare Twisted and now Uncle Derek with the Gameboy Camera.

@3:29 from what I recall the "perfect head mode" (hehe) was removed because of the recent school shootings in America and Nintendo's concern that people would put unauthorized pictures of others and creating a PR nightmare and tainting Nintendo's kid friendly image.
Good lord I forgot all about those tomodachi life clips, about to go down a rabbit hole again
